doc:
Gilbert Gil https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilbert_Gil 0 Enrique Gil Gilbert (July 8, 1912 – February 21, 1973) was an Ecuadorian novelist, journalist, poet, and a high-ranking member of the Communist Party of Ecuador. Gil Gilbert was born and died in the coastal city of Guayaquil, and was the youngest member of the Guayaquil Group, which was one of the most renowned literary and intellectual groups in Ecuador in 1930–40. Gil Gilbert’s most famous novel is Nuestro Pan (Our Daily Bread) (1942), which was translated into English (1943), German, Japanese, and Czech. The novel won Honourable Mention in the Latin-American Prize Novel Competition. Enrique_Gil_Gilbert ( July_8_,_1912 – February_21_,_1973 ) was an_Ecuadorian_novelist , journalist , poet , and a_high-ranking_member of the_Communist_Party of Ecuador . Gil_Gilbert ’s_most_famous_novel is Nuestro_Pan ( Our_Daily_Bread ) (_1942_) , which was_translated into English_(_1943_) , German_,_Japanese_,_and_Czech . The_novel_won_Honourable_Mention in the_Latin-American_Prize_Novel_Competition .
